title: Kanako Ito (footballer)
text:
is a Japanese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player. She plays for <a href="Chifure%20AS%20Elfen%20Saitama">Chifure AS Elfen Saitama</a>. She played for <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a>.
Club career.
Ito was born in <a href="Nerima">Nerima</a>, <a href="Tokyo">Tokyo</a> on July 20, 1983. She joined <a href="Nippon%20TV%20Beleza">NTV Beleza</a> (later "Nippon TV Beleza") in 1999. She was selected Best Eleven in <a href="2001%20L.League">2001</a> and <a href="2002%20L.League">2002</a>. End of 2008 season, she left the club, but in 2010, she came back and she played until 2012. From 2013, she played for <a href="Chifure%20AS%20Elfen%20Saitama">Chifure AS Elfen Saitama</a> (2013-2014, 2016), <a href="INAC%20Kobe%20Leonessa">INAC Kobe Leonessa</a> (2015) and <a href="Nippon%20Sport%20Science%20University%20Fields%20Yokohama">Nippon Sport Science University Fields Yokohama</a> (2017). She is currently playing for <a href="Chifure%20AS%20Elfen%20Saitama">Chifure AS Elfen Saitama</a> from 2018.
National team career.
On August 5, 2001, when Ito was 18 years old, she debuted for the <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Japan national team</a> against <a href="China%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">China</a>. In 2002, she was selected by the <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Japan U-20 national team</a> for the <a href="2002%20FIFA%20U-19%20Women%27s%20World%20Championship">2002 U-19 World Championship</a>. She played 13 games and scored 3 goals for Japan until 2012.
